Uses of Class
com.rockhoppertech.music.midi.js.MIDITrack

  • Packages that use MIDITrack 
    Package Description
    com.rockhoppertech.music
    These are the "core" or essential music classes.
    com.rockhoppertech.music.chord
    Chord classes.
    com.rockhoppertech.music.fx.app2  
    com.rockhoppertech.music.midi.js
    These are the classes that use JavaSound to manipulate MIDI files, create MIDI data, and play them.
    com.rockhoppertech.music.midi.js.xml
    XML Parsers used by factories.
    com.rockhoppertech.music.midi.parse
    MIDI String Parsing.
    com.rockhoppertech.music.scale
    Scale classes.

      the pattern is a collection of indices into the notelist. no bounds checking Integer[] pattern = new Integer[] 0, 0, 3, 2, 1 ; MIDITrack patterned = MIDITrackFactory .applyPattern( notelist, pattern); } A cleaner replacement for getNoteListPattern(blah blah) but doesn't do the hanon like sequencing - which you can do externally

      map is the GoF visitor(331) design pattern.

      map calls the NoteModifier's map only if the note's start beat is after the specified value.

      static MIDITrack MIDITrackFactory.modifyPitchIntervals(MIDITrack track, CircularList<Integer> values, boolean absolute)
      Track ints = MIDITrackFactory.createFromIntervals(1, 2, 3, 4, 5); CircularList<Integer> values = new CircularArrayList<Integer>(); values.add(1); MIDITrack modints = MIDITrackFactory.modifyPitchIntervals(ints, values, true); // so intervals 1 2 3 4 5 become 2 3 4 5 6

      sublist will get MIDINotes with start times between the given time.

      sublist is sort of a band pass filter.
